response.overview: In "Tramping in Bohemia," a group of Czech tramps returns home to revisit their old way of life some 40 years after they emigrated. Many longtime friends remain there, but the country they return to has changed greatly. In the modern, free Czech Republic, is there still a place for these old romantics and the youth culture that defined them? And for those who didn't leave, was the freedom they found in tramping enough to sustain them?
response.tagline: In Communist Czechoslovakia, it wasn't so difficult to find a sense of freedom. All you needed was a backpack, a guitar, and a spot to sleep out under the stars.
response.title: Tramping in Bohemia
